adjective.description: Used to express feelings of annoyance, surprise, or pleasure.
examples: it's doggone good to be home

verb.description: Used to express surprise, irritation, or anger.
examples: from that moment, doggone it if I didn't see a motivation in Joey!
I'll be doggoned if every fourth kid is affected

origin: Early 19th century: probably from dog on it, euphemism for God damn it.
